That's a beautiful way to apply John 13:34 to your life! Showing love and support to your sister during a difficult time is a wonderful way to demonstrate the kind of love that Jesus commanded. By being present, listening, and offering practical help, you can be a tangible representation of God's love to her.

Remember, it's often the small, everyday acts of love and kindness that can make the biggest difference in someone's life. Your sister will likely appreciate the extra attention and care, and it may even bring you closer together as siblings.

As you reach out to your sister, keep in mind the following:

1. **Listen actively**: When you talk to your sister, make sure to actively listen to her concerns, fears, and feelings. Sometimes, people just need someone to hear them out and validate their emotions.
2. **Be present**: Spend quality time with your sister, even if it's just a quick phone call or visit. Your physical presence can be comforting and reassuring.
3. **Offer specific help**: Instead of just saying "let me know if you need anything," offer specific ways you can help, like running errands, cooking meals, or helping with household chores.
4. **Be patient and understanding**: Living with health issues can be frustrating and challenging. Be patient and understanding when your sister is having a tough day or struggling with her emotions.
5. **Pray for her**: Don't forget to pray for your sister, asking God to comfort, heal, and strengthen her during this difficult time.

As you pour out love and care to your sister, remember that you're not only showing love to her, but also to Jesus Himself. In Matthew 25:40, Jesus says, "Truly I tell you, whatever you did for one of the least of these brothers and sisters of mine, you did for me." Your acts of love and kindness to your sister are a reflection of your love for Jesus.

May God bless you and your sister during this challenging time, and may your love and care for her bring glory to His name.
